OTrecod 0.1.0
  • Reference

A simulated dataset to test the functions of the OTrecod package

simu_data.Rd

The first 300 rows belong to the database A, while the next 400 rows belong to the database B. Five covariates: Gender, Treatment, Dosage, Smoking and Age are common to both databases (same encodings). The variables Yb1 and Yb2 are the target variables that summarize a same information saved in two distinct encodings, that is why, Yb1 is missing in the database B and Yb2 is missing in the database A.

simu_data

Format

A data frame with 700 observations on the following 8 variables.

DB

database identification, a character with 2 possible classes: A or B

Yb1

the target variable encoded in 3 ordered classes in DB A, missing in database B, stored as factor

Yb2

the target variable encoded in 5 ordered classes in DB B, missing in database A, stored as integer

Gender

a complete 2 class covariate saved as factor

Treatment

a 3 class covariates stored as a character with 2% of missing information

Dosage

a 4-levels factor, with 5% of missing information

Smoking

a 2 classes covariate stored as a character: NO for non smoker, YES otherwise. 10% of missing information

Age

a double corresponding to the age of participants in years. The last covariate of the database counts 5% of missing information

Source

randomly generated

Details

The purpose of the functions contained in this package is to predict the missing information on Yb1 and Yb2 in database A and database B using the Optimal Transportation Theory.

Missing information has been simulated to some covariates following a simple MCAR process.

Contents

Developed by Gregory Guernec, Valerie Gares.
